channel.title: Global Update Function [317]
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I was wondering if there's a global update function that is called when the server is running?
I'm trying to create a mini-game but can't seem to get the function to happen in the right class. I don't want to have to rely on the client class calling it as this will mean there will be some serious lag. In simple, I need the server to call the command every time it loops through it, kind of like an "int main" loop that never returns.
Anybody got any ideas on this?
Thanks.

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Yes, the loop is constantly running…

Read full topic

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @alexc95 alexc95
item.description:
@alexc95 wrote:

Looking at the comments above is kind of what I expected. Though, there is no function in the server file that is called every update. Strange really, I would of kind of expected that.

Anyway, Instead, I wrote the class for the game and stuck it in a new process/thread and set it on a while(true) loop. Is there any disadvantages to this? Would it be a good idea for me to set a sleep at the end of the function/loop or would the memory not be an issue? In honesty, the loop only checks if the game time is up and if it is, ends the game. There’s no object handling apart from when a player actually recieves an item.

Read full topic

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

As every rsps has so far

Read full topic

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:4, topic:420916”]^^ yes, there is an update loop every 600ms (that’s what needed in order for the server to run, and not mis-behave). This should be in server.java…[/quote]You don’t need it to loop every 600ms for it to run. You just need to send the player update block to the client every 600ms. Our current server engine model is veeerrrryyyyy inefficient. It takes probably 200ms to process and update so the other 400ms are wasted unless you write some tacky code that rapes your memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

^^ yes, there is an update loop every 600ms (that’s what needed in order for the server to run, and not mis-behave). This should be in server.java…

Read full topic

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

PlayerHandler or World or whatever the class is called in your base generally updates the game logic every 600ms… That’s where mini game updating should go…

Read full topic

item.title: Global Update Function [317]
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

You have to create the function yourself, unless you rip it from pest control or another minigame that has one such as castle wars.

Read full topic
